channel.title: Post on John Houghton
channel.description: Recent content in Post on John Houghton

item.title: Portfolio Optimization in R
item.description: Project Summary I’ve always wanted to build out some tools to start managing my portfolio. I was recently inspired by Matt Dancho @ business-science.io, an author of the tidyquant package, who wrote an article describing his initial interest in R for investment portfolio optimization and his quick success at quickly turning around his performance through quantitative analytics. Now that he’s written tidyquant, financial analysis and portfolio optimization is much more user friendly, so I thought I’d give it a go.

item.title: Titanic Kaggle
item.description: Titanic: Machine Learning from disaster https://www.kaggle.com/c/titanic library(knitr) library(rmdformats) ## Global options options(max.print="75") opts_chunk$set(#echo=FALSE, cache=TRUE, prompt=FALSE, tidy=TRUE, comment=NA, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, results='asis' ) opts_knit$set(width=75) print("notebook options imported successfully!") ## [1] "notebook options imported successfully!" # set the working directory setwd("~/Documents/GitHub/titanic_kaggle_ml") # read data files test.data <- read.csv("test.csv", na.strings = c("NA","")) train.data <- read.csv("train.csv", na.strings = c("NA","")) # convert ints factors train.data$Survived = factor(train.data$Survived) train.data$Pclass = factor(train.data$Pclass) # test.data$Survived = factor(test.data$Survived) # test.

item.title: How to Make Awesome R Markdown for Blogdown
item.description: knitr::read_chunk('~/Documents/Github/r_snippets/blogdown.R') R Notebook Options blogdown documentation here: https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/html-document.html Knitr Examples on Github https://github.com/yihui/knitr-examples ## CheatSheet https://www.ethz.ch/content/dam/ethz/special-interest/math/statistics/sfs/Education/Advanced%20Studies%20in%20Applied%20Statistics/course-material-1719/Datenanalyse/rmarkdown-2.pdf Markdown Themes rmdformats package https://github.com/juba/rmdformats The github README.md provides some good examples Here’s a great collection of examples of themes http://www.datadreaming.org/post/r-markdown-theme-gallery/ Custom Build Functions https://yutani.rbind.io/post/2017-10-25-blogdown-custom/

item.title: Hugo Templates
item.description: Great Resource on getting started with blogdown https://alison.rbind.io/post/up-and-running-with-blogdown/ A bunch of great blogdown sites for inspiration https://awesome-blogdown.com/ Undefined (theme name not given!) https://www.garrickadenbuie.com/about/ Learn https://github.com/matcornic/hugo-theme-learn/ Variant of Learn = Dockdock https://docdock.netlify.com/ Beautiful Hugo https://github.com/halogenica/beautifulhugo Future Imperfect Hugo Theme Page User Site that I like https://marionlouveaux.fr/ Pros front page is most recent article great sidebar clean look Universal Theme https://github.

item.title: Migrate Content Test

item.title: Rebalancing Tool
item.description: Resources Performance Analysis Vignette https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tidyquant/vignettes/TQ05-performance-analysis-with-tidyquant.html Really great article I walked through https://rstudio-pubs-static.s3.amazonaws.com/333431_8a130f2ff7f84e4faee2a4ac01d6c30e.html Really great article #2 - same as above or extended? https://rpubs.com/mr148/333431 Backtesting 4 Portfolio Optimization Strategies In R https://seekingalpha.com/article/4166115-backtesting-4-portfolio-optimization-strategies-r Using ROI Solvers for Portfolio Analytics, Vignette https://rdrr.io/cran/PortfolioAnalytics/f/inst/doc/ROI_vignette.pdf R Notebook Options knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, progress = TRUE, verbose = TRUE, error=TRUE, cache = TRUE) Load Required Libraries & Set Paths ## ── Attaching packages ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
